Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove its validity.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Facebook has implemented a new rule without providing any concrete evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statements made by Facebook's communications manager, who confirmed that the viral post is not true.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the consequences of the alleged new rule by stating that all photos and messages become public, even if they have been deleted or are not allowed to be used in public.
Understate: No instances of understatement bias are present in the provided claim.
Falters at times: No instances of the claim faltering at times are evident in the provided information.
Exist alternative explanation: No alternative explanations are presented in the provided claim.
